column4: EU mergers and takeovers (Feb 15)
column5: BRUSSELS  Feb 15 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process:

column4: Amgen blood cell disorder drug meets primary goal in phase 3 trial
column5: Feb 15 Biopharmaceutical company Amgen Inc  said on Monday its Aranesp drug met its primary goal of reducing the incidence of red blood cell transfusions in anemic patients suffering from Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) in a phase 3 trial.

column4: Pets are comforting  but shares of pet-focused companies may not be
column5: Feb 15 Come economic rain or shine  Americans spend $60 billion a year on their pets  a fact that has led investors to seek shelter in pet company shares when the stock market goes to the dogs.

column4: Pets are comforting  but shares of pet-focused companies may not be
column5: Feb 15 Come economic rain or shine  Americans spend $60 billion a year on their pets  a fact that has led investors to seek shelter in pet company shares when the stock market goes to the dogs.

column4: BRIEF-Zealand steps into phase II development in 2016 for ZP1848 for short bowel syndrome
column5: * Zealand doses the first patients with ZP1848 for short bowel syndrome  advancing the second of its proprietary specialty medicines into phase II development in 2016

column4: BlackRock says no need to stress test mutual fund sector
column5: LONDON BlackRock  the world's biggest asset manager  says there is no need for a stress test of whether the mutual fund industry could repay a large number of panicking investors in the event of a fresh financial crisis.

column4: BlackRock says no need to stress test mutual fund sector
column5: LONDON  Feb 15 BlackRock  the world's biggest asset manager  says there is no need for a stress test of whether the mutual fund industry could repay a large number of panicking investors in the event of a fresh financial crisis.

column4: Boeing sees new aircraft demand worth $550 billion in Southeast Asia over 20 years
column5: SINGAPORE Southeast Asia requires 3 750 new aircraft worth $550 billion in 20 years from 2015  a senior Boeing  executive told a press conference ahead of the Singapore Airshow that starts on Tuesday.

column4: Boeing sees new aircraft demand worth $550 bln in SE Asia in 20 yrs
column5: SINGAPORE  Feb 15 Southeast Asia requires 3 750 new aircraft worth $550 billion in 20 years from 2015  a senior Boeing executive told a press conference ahead of the Singapore Airshow that starts on Tuesday.

column4: Australia's Asciano bins $6.4 bln Brookfield bid it had endorsed
column5: SYDNEY Australian ports and rail giant Asciano Ltd  formally dumped an A$8.9 billion ($6.4 billion) buyout from Canada's Brookfield Asset Management Inc  after it failed to match a higher offer from local rival Qube Holdings Ltd .

column4: Australia's Asciano bins $6.4 bln Brookfield bid it had endorsed
column5: SYDNEY  Feb 16 Australian ports and rail giant Asciano Ltd formally dumped an A$8.9 billion ($6.4 billion) buyout from Canada's Brookfield Asset Management Inc  after it failed to match a higher offer from local rival Qube Holdings Ltd.

column4: Shell pursues transition plan after sealing $53 bln BG deal
column5: LONDON  Feb 15 Royal Dutch Shell on Monday sealed the $53 billion (36 billion pounds) acquisition of British rival BG Group to form the world's top liquefied natural gas company  even as slumping oil prices cast a shadow on the upcoming years of transition.

column4: Deutsche Bank carbon traders concealed information says prosecutor
column5: FRANKFURT  Feb 15 Deutsche Bank  employees alleged to have evaded tax when buying and selling carbon emission certificates had concerns over whether their trading activity was legal but carried on anyway to maximize profits  a Frankfurt court heard on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-Moody's says expects Deutsche Bank to make its AT1 payments
column5: * We think that Deutsche Bank is positioned to make its April 2016 AT1 payment  and  barring a major  unforeseen event  will be positioned to make its April 2017 AT1 payment  Further company coverage:

column4: FMC acquires Japan's largest dialysis group: FAZ newspaper
column5: FRANKFURT German kidney dialysis provider Fresenius Medical Care has acquired Japan's largest dialysis group with about 6 000 patients  newspaper Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung reported on Monday  citing a presentation made by the company in January.

column4: FMC acquires Japan's largest dialysis group -FAZ newspaper
column5: FRANKFURT  Feb 15 German kidney dialysis provider Fresenius Medical Care has acquired Japan's largest dialysis group with about 6 000 patients  newspaper Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung reported on Monday  citing a presentation made by the company in January.

column4: HSBC keeps headquarters in London  rejects move to Hong Kong
column5: LONDON/HONG KONG Banking group HSBC Holdings  has decided to keep its headquarters in Britain  rejecting the option of shifting its center of gravity back to main profit-generating hub Hong Kong after a 10-month review. | Video

column4: Fitch: HSBC HQ Decision Has No Impact on Business Strategy
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  February 15 (Fitch) HSBC Holdings plc's (HSBC) decision to keep its  headquarters in London has no impact on the group's business strategy  says  Fitch Ratings. In our opinion  the protracted debate over where the group's  non-operating holding company should be registered  which in turn determines  which authorities assume consolidated supervision  never detracted from  management's central strategic focus  originally outlined

column4: UPDATE-HSBC opts to keep its HQ in London
column5: LONDON  Feb 15 (IFR) - HSBC Holdings said it is keeping its headquarters in Britain  after a 10-month review that considered moving its base to Hong Kong or elsewhere.

column4: 'Brexit' could lead to HSBC moving 1 000 jobs to Paris: Sky
column5: HONG KONG HSBC Holdings   could move around 1 000 employees from London to Paris in the event that Britain votes to leave the European Union  the bank's Chief Executive Stuart Gulliver was quoted saying by Sky News on Monday.

column4: 'Brexit' could lead to HSBC moving 1 000 jobs to Paris -Sky
column5: HONG KONG  Feb 15 HSBC Holdings   could move around 1 000 employees from London to Paris in the event that Britain votes to leave the European Union  the bank's Chief Executive Stuart Gulliver was quoted saying by Sky News on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Russia's Gazprombank to gain Elga project in Mechel debt deal -sources
column5: * Gazprombank to pay off some of Mechel's Sberbank debt -sources

column4: Russia's Gazprombank to get Mechel's Elga in exchange for some of debt to Sberbank - sources
column5: MOSCOW  Feb 15 Russia's Gazprombank will get Mechel's Elga coal project in exchange for paying off some of the coal and steel company's debt to Sberbank  according to a preliminary debt restructuring deal  two banking sources told Reuters.

column4: BRIEF-FinTech Group enters strategic partnership with Morgan Stanley
column5: * Enters strategic partnership for exchange traded products with Morgan Stanley

column4: Orange and Bouygues Telecom seen reaching a deal in March - sources
column5: PARIS Orange  and Bouygues  are likely to reach an initial agreement on the sale of Bouygues's telecoms unit in March at the earliest  amid wrangling over terms that would make Bouygues the second biggest shareholder in Orange after the French state  sources close to the matter said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Orange and Bouygues Telecom seen reaching a deal in March - sources
column5: * Bouygues' potential stake in Orange under scrutiny -sources

column4: Orange says Bouygues Telecom talks continuing  no deal reached
column5: PARIS  Feb 15 French telecoms group Orange  denied on Monday that any deal had been reached to divide up Bouygues Telecom assets after weekend press reports that a preliminary agreement could be presented on Tuesday when Orange publishes full-year earnings.

column4: Hong Kong's BEA rejects activist investor Elliott's demand for bank sale
column5: HONG KONG  Feb 15 Bank of East Asia Ltd   a family-run Hong Kong lender  rejected a call by activist investor Elliott Management Corp to put the bank up for sale  saying the challenging economic and business environment would bode ill for such a process.

column4: Taiwan stocks slip but heavyweight TSMC recoups early losses
column5: TAIPEI  Feb 15 Taiwan stocks slipped on Monday in their first trading session after the long Lunar New Year holidays  tracking gains in some regional bourses  with TSMC  leading heavyweights higher.

column4: Toyota resumes production at Japan plants after steel shortage
column5: TOKYO  Feb 15 Toyota Motor Corp resumed production at its vehicle assembly plants in Japan on Monday following a one-week stoppage after an explosion at an affiliate's steel plant resulted in a steel shortage.

column4: Virgin Atlantic turns flight back to UK after laser incident
column5: LONDON A Virgin Atlantic [VA.UL] flight heading to New York returned to London Heathrow airport on Sunday after a "laser beam incident"  the British airline said.

column4: Disney's Hong Kong park posts loss as Chinese visitor numbers skid
column5: SHANGHAI Walt Disney Co's  Hong Kong theme park posted its first net loss in four years in 2015 as Chinese visitor numbers slumped  a potential headache for the U.S. firm as it prepares to open its first mainland Chinese park in June.
